nodes.title: Communist Party of China (CCP)
nodes.short_description: Ruling party directing governance, economy, security, and ideology nationwide.

nodes.title: Xi Jinping
nodes.short_description: Paramount leader steering policy, reform, security, and foreign strategy.

nodes.title: United States
nodes.short_description: Top trade partner and rival shaping sanctions, tech access, and geopolitics.

nodes.title: People's Bank of China (PBOC)
nodes.short_description: Central bank managing monetary policy, credit growth, and financial stability.

nodes.title: National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC)
nodes.short_description: Macro planner allocating investment, industrial policy, pricing, and energy quotas.

nodes.title: Real estate sector
nodes.short_description: Core driver of investment, local revenues, household wealth, and systemic risk.

nodes.title: Semiconductor industry
nodes.short_description: Strategic industry underpinning innovation, security, and economic competitiveness.

nodes.title: Bureau of Industry and Security (BIS)
nodes.short_description: U.S. export controls limiting China's access to advanced chips and tools.

nodes.title: Taiwan
nodes.short_description: Geopolitical flashpoint and semiconductor hub shaping security and supply chains.

nodes.title: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC)
nodes.short_description: Leading foundry gating advanced chips crucial to Chinese technology.

nodes.title: ASML Holding
nodes.short_description: Sole EUV supplier constraining China's leading-edge chip manufacturing.

nodes.title: U.S.–China trade war (2018–present)
nodes.short_description: Tariffs and restrictions disrupting trade, supply chains, and industrial policy.

nodes.title: COVID-19 pandemic
nodes.short_description: Health crisis triggering lockdowns, supply shocks, and demand swings.

nodes.title: China's WTO accession (2001)
nodes.short_description: Integrated China into global trade, boosting exports and foreign investment.
